text: Anyone else strangely excited about this movie? <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1roy4o4tqQM> *Disclaimer* I grew up in the 90s/early 2000s.
“strangely”
The only thing that makes me excited by it is Ryan Reynolds voice coming out of a cute cuddly pikachu
agreed, i am not a fan of pokemon, but Ryan Reynold, yes
like no joke, I think that was their real premise behind the movie
“lets do Ted, but with Ryan Reynolds and a beloved franchise from everyone’s childhood”
his cameo in a million ways to die in the west was hilarious

I really hope in the next movie that involves Deadpool, that they make some jokes referencing detective pikachu.

“Do you think Ryan Reynolds landed a role as a talking electrified rodent because of his dashing looks?”

Is adobe stock shitting the bed for anyone else? I’m getting a 500 error page:

<https://stock.adobe.com/>

nothing mentioned on twitter:

<https://twitter.com/adobestock>

so i thought maybe it was just me!
page loads for me
coolio, thanks for checking!

made me think though.
“steps to make the web look like it’s 1998 again, knock out Adobe Typekit and google fonts, disable cloudflare - because dial-up speed was amazing - said no one ever…”
makes me want to dust off a copy of Windows 98!
lol
Windows ME anyone?
nah man, Microsoft Bob is where it’s at
sorry re-linking because slack didn’t want to show the screenshot in all it’s glory
<https://spin.d.pr/2w9eMF>
>>>Looks like you're trying to do something... need help?
Who needs anti-aliasing when you’ve got a dog and a paperclip acting like that know-it-all kid in class who wasn’t actually paying attention to what’s going on
Best thing Microsoft ever did was for april fools they brought clippy back by adding it to office 360
Meet Sprocky, you're new Virtual Design Manager Assistant.
I see a potential april fools joke for the <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension>
<@U2H3TT8F2> actually I’m looking for some good documentation regarding to custom module. Is there any page where I can find decent tutorial how to create modules on my local repo (FTP way)
I dont do the local dev stuff much. <@U26B530N6> may be able to help with that or i think <@U7ADCU3BM> may have done some local stuff before
We don’t have a ton of documentation on this, but there is a little info here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/HubSpot-ftp#directory-structure>
ooh, I think that page got some updates recently, feel like there’s a bunch of new things in there.
